TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: No issues were noted during the 2011 PCEM. Trench subsidence issues are noted in element 2(d).

TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Trench settlement issues causing high crown along the right-of-way can potentially alter natural flow patterns. See Trench Subsidence element. No water flow issues of concern were identified in 2011.

Recommendations: Continue monitoring trench settlement along the entire right-of-way in 2013.

Environmental Issues: (a) Loss of wetland habitat and loss or reduction of hydrological function (filtration)
TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: During the 2011 PCEM, low-lying areas along the right-of-way were observed to be consistent with pre-construction drainage contours.
Recommendations: Continue monitoring the re-establishment of ground cover, soil erosion potential and weed growth.

Environmental Issues: (a) Loss or alteration of native vegetation and vegetation important to wildlife
TERA* Mitigative Measures and Observatio: Low-growing shrubs and grasses were observed along the right-of-way at the time of the PCEM program but require more time to establish.
TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Low-growing shrubs and grasses continue to establish well but require further monitoring.
TERA Observations in 2012: Unable to assess vegetation due to snow cover.
Recommendations: Continue to monitor the re-establishment of low-growing shrubs and grasses on the right-of-way.

TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Narrow-leaved hawk's-beard was observed at low densities along the entire route during the 2011 PCEM.
TERA Observations in 2012: Unable to assess weeds due to snow cover.
Recommendations: Continue monitoring right-of-way for weed growth and introduction in 2013.

TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Sweet clover was observed at low densities along the entire line and in moderate densities at KP 14.7 and from KP 28.0 to KP 30.0 during the 2011 PCEM.
TERA Observations in 2012: Unable to assess weeds due to snow cover.
Recommendations: Continue monitoring right-of-way for weed growth and introduction in 2013.

TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Scentless chamomile was observed at low densities along the majority of the pipeline with a high density infestation at KP 14.7.
TERA Observations in 2012: Unable to assess weeds due to snow cover.
Recommendations: Apply chemical control for scentless chamomile. Continue monitoring right-of-way for weed growth and introduction in 2013.

TERA* Mitigative Measures and Observatio: Flagged rare plant populations in October 2009. Reduced work site dimensions and lessened disturbance to vegetation by minimising grubbing and/or ramping over rare plant populations in flagged locations. At flagged rare plant locations, stripped a narrow blade width centered over the trench. If rare plants were flagged in areas where grading was required, stripped and stored grubbings and strippings separately and marked their location to ensure these materials were replaced in the same area during clean‐up.
TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Revisited rare plant populations of European water-hemlock, northern bog bedstraw and western Jacob's-ladder.
TERA Observations in 2012: Rare plants not assessed in 2012.
Recommendations: Continue to monitor the 8 unresolved populations of rare plants.

TERA* Mitigative Measures and Observatio: At flagged rare plant locations, placed swamp or rig mats over the spoil side and placed ditch spoil on top of the mats, to prevent ditch spoil from mixing with the unstripped surface materials. Replaced strippings in areas of rare plants in the same location as they were removed.
TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: <s>See above</s>
TERA Observations in 2012: <s>See above</s>
Recommendations: <s>See above</s>

Environmental Issues: (a) Loss or alteration of potential wildlife habitat
Recommendations: See Vegetation element.

TERA* Mitigative Measures and Observatio: An additional borrow site was acquired from British Columbia Crown lands. Site was approximately 1 km from pipeline, immediately adjacent and accessible by road. The trees and brush were removed, topsoil stripped and stockpiled on-site and the small borrow pit was developed. Borrow site was left with stable slope angles and public access is restricted. Drainage for the hydrostatic test water was established before the water was released. Water was released into an excavated sump under controlled conditions before it flowed into natural drainage in the area. Area was reseeded.
TERA Mitigative Measures and Observation: Area not assessed in 2011.
TERA Observations in 2012: Unable to assess due to snow cover.
Recommendations: Assess borrow pit area for general environmental condition (weeds, vegetation establishment, drainage etc.) in 2013.
